get_started.title: Getting Started
get_started.description: The SSI Snap is a MetaMask Snap, that can handle DIDs, securely store VCs, create VPs and is designed to be blockchain-agnostic.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Welcome blockchain explorers! If you ever wanted to integrate the powerful world of Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI), Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs), and Verifiable Credentials (VCs) into decentralized applications (dApps), you have found the right place. No need for additional platforms and wallets, only one of the most popular web3 wallets is required - MetaMask.

plugins/ssi-snap-connector.title: SSI Snap Connector
plugins/ssi-snap-connector.description: SSI Snap connector is used to install SSI snap and expose API toward snap on dApps and other applications.

plugins/vc-manager.title: VCManager (Veramo)
plugins/vc-manager.description: Ceramic network support is experimental and still under development!

roadmap.title: Roadmap
roadmap.description: Are you interested in how SSI Snap will evolve in the future?

ssi-snap/architecture.title: Architecture
ssi-snap/architecture.description: Veramo client powers the SSI Snap.

ssi-snap/design.title: Design
ssi-snap/design.description: The SSI Snap is a MetaMask Snap, that can handle DIDs, securely store VCs, and create the VPs. It is designed to be blockchain-agnostic. SSI Snap uses existing MetaMask accounts as DIDs or as a mean to create new DIDs, without the need to ever export private keys from MetaMask, hence leveraging its security!

ssi-snap/intro.title: MetaMask Snaps - Basics
ssi-snap/intro.description: The most popular wallet, MetaMask, introduced Snaps, which makes building plugins for additional functionality possible. MetaMask is a crypto wallet and gateway to blockchain apps, providing a simple interface for users to interact with EVM-based blockchains, sign and send transactions, etc. Snaps make a wide specter of new applications possible. They can enable support for previously unsupported chains like Polkadot, Solana, Bitcoin, etc. They allow dApps to modify MetaMask's state to store and retrieve data, like VCs. They also enable access to the web and the possibility to leverage practically any API and much more. New functionality is only limited by the creativity of developers. Here is a list of already developed Snaps!

ssi-snap/storage.title: Storage
ssi-snap/storage.description: SSI Snap utilizes MetaMask's state to store data. SSI Snap modifies the SSISnapState object.

ssi/did.title: Decentralized Identifier (DID)
ssi/did.description: Decentralized Identifiers (W3C Decentralized Identifiers), or DIDs in short, are the new type of unique and persistent identifiers (URI) that enable verifiable and decentralized identity. They are entirely controlled by the identity owner and are independent of centralized authorities. Each individual can create as many DIDs as they wish and use each in different contexts to prevent data correlation.

ssi/ssi.title: Introduction
ssi/ssi.description: There are three main components to a digital self-sovereign identity: DIDs, VCs, and VPs.

ssi/trust-model.title: VC Trust Model
ssi/trust-model.description: SSI completely changes the paradigm of online data sharing and brings it closer to the physical world. There are three entities in the VC trust model:

ssi/vc.title: Verifiable Credentials (VC)
ssi/vc.description: Verifiable Credentials (W3C Verifiable Credentials), or VCs for short, are an open standard for digital credentials to solve this issue. They are digitally signed and can be verified cryptographically, which makes them tamper-proof. VCs work well with data privacy, which goes well with data regulations pushed by the European Union (GDPR) and some other countries.

ssi/vp.title: Verifiable Presentation (VP)
ssi/vp.description: Verifiable Presentation, or VP for short, expresses data from one or more VCs and is packaged so that the authorship of the data is verifiable. The data in a VP, which is often about the same subject, could have been issued by multiple issuers. Let's say you're required to prove your University degree, past employment, and date of birth. Each of these credentials is issued by a different entity, and the owner can combine them to create a single VP.

team/blockchain_lab.title: Blockchain Lab:UM
team/blockchain_lab.description: A multidisciplinary team of researchers, developers and consultants who develop and evaluate blockchain-based services.
